ticket.title: Privileged lifecycle integration for sublease and review handlers

tickets.reason: Privileged handlers require finalized core PCAC types and deny classes.
RequestTool lifecycle wiring establishes baseline kernel integration patterns.

in_scope: Adopt join/consume lifecycle enforcement in DelegateSublease handler.
Adopt join/consume lifecycle enforcement in IngestReviewReceipt handler.
Enforce delegation narrowing and lineage bindings for delegated authority paths.
Keep policy-flagged rollout semantics without protocol wire break.
out_of_scope: RequestTool lifecycle implementation changes outside shared helper extraction.
Sovereignty epoch composition checks for Tier2+ consume.

steps: Introduce shared join-input builders for privileged handlers with delegation/identity/freshness bindings.
Wire lifecycle stages to privileged paths and emit required receipts with selector bindings.
Add strict-subset delegation widening deny checks and regression tests.
Add rollout-flag coverage tests proving no wire break under policy toggles.
Run cargo fmt --all && cargo clippy --workspace --all-targets --all-features -- -D warnings && cargo test --workspace.

criteria: DelegateSublease and IngestReviewReceipt require lifecycle checks before authoritative acceptance.
Privileged lifecycle rollout is policy-switchable without wire protocol breakage.

notes.security: Privileged paths must not remain outside the same lifecycle contract as RequestTool.
notes.verification: Include delegated-path negative tests for widening, missing lineage, and missing lifecycle selectors.
